analyzed: 'di la yid gzhan zhes pa shed bu ste tshangs pa'i bu'o //
translated: The word other refers to the sons of Brahma.

original: tshangs pa'i nyin gcig ni shed bu'i bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i nyin gcig ni shed bu'i bcu bzhi'o //
translated: One day of Brahma is fourteen of the sons of Brahma.

original: de la shed bu'i nyi ma gcig ni lha rnams kyi dus bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi tshad do //
analyzed: de la shed bu'i nyi ma gcig ni lha rnams kyi dus bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi tshad do //
translated: One day of the sons of Brahma is seventy-two of the gods.

original: de yang mi rnams kyi dus ni brgyad cu rtsa bzhi lhag pa'i brgya phrag gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang mi rnams kyi dus ni brgyad cu rtsa bzhi lhag pa'i brgya phrag gnyis so //
translated: That is two hundred and eighty-four of humans.

original: shed bu de nyid bcu bzhi rnams kyis lha'i dus dgu bcu rtsa bzhi lhag pa'i brgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shed bu de nyid bcu bzhi rnams kyis lha'i dus dgu bcu rtsa bzhi lhag pa'i brgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: The same kalpa of Manu, multiplied by fourteen, makes a day of the gods, which is equal to a hundred of our years.

original: mi'i ni dus nyi shu rtsa bzhis dman pa'i dus stong phrag bzhi'o //
analyzed: mi'i ni dus nyi shu rtsa bzhis dman pa'i dus stong phrag bzhi'o //
translated: The day of the gods of the world of Brahma is equal to a thousand years in the world of Manu, and this day has the same duration as a human life.

original: 'di yang shed bu rnams kyi stong phrag nyi shu rtsa brgyad lhag pa'i mi lo 'bum phrag bcu bdun gyi grangs te rdzogs ldan gyi tshad do //
analyzed: 'di yang shed bu rnams kyi stong phrag nyi shu rtsa brgyad lhag pa'i mi lo 'bum phrag bcu bdun gyi grangs te rdzogs ldan gyi tshad do //
translated: This day of the gods of the world of Brahma is equal to a human life of 1,728,000,000,000 years.

original: bco lnga ni mtshams sbyor du 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½de skad du nyi ma'i grub mtha' las /
analyzed: bco lnga ni mtshams sbyor du 'gyur ro // de skad du nyi ma'i grub mtha' las /

original: dus rnams bdun cu gcig bcas pa //ğŸ”½'di ni shed bu'i yin par 'dod //ğŸ”½de ni rdzogs ldan lo grangs te //
analyzed: dus rnams bdun cu gcig bcas pa // 'di ni shed bu'i yin par 'dod // de ni rdzogs ldan lo grangs te //
translated: The life of the gods of the world of Brahma is a kalpa, i.e., 4,320,000,000,000 human years.

original: de ni mtshams sbyor rab tu brjod //
analyzed: de ni mtshams sbyor rab tu brjod //
translated: The kalpa of disappearance lasts from the disappearance of the first hell being until the disappearance of the universe.

original: shed bu yi ni dus de yang //
analyzed: shed bu yi ni dus de yang //
translated: The kalpa of creation lasts from the primordial wind until the creation of a human being on earth.

original: bcu gnyis bskal par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis bskal par shes par bya'o //
translated: The kalpa of creation is so called because the creatures, gods and humans, are created.

original: rdzogs ldan tshad kyi bskal pa yi //
analyzed: rdzogs ldan tshad kyi bskal pa yi //
translated: The kalpa of disappearance is so called because creatures disappear.

original: dang po'i mtshams sbyor bco lngar brjod //
analyzed: dang po'i mtshams sbyor bco lngar brjod //
translated: The kalpa of creation lasts from the primordial wind until the creation of a human being on earth.ğŸ”½The kalpa of creation is so called because the creatures, gods and humans, are created.ğŸ”½The kalpa of disappearance is so called because creatures disappear.

original: ces so // rdzogs ldan dus kyi bskal pa ni rtsod ldan dus kyi tshad do //ğŸ”½rkang pa gnyis ni gnyis ldan gyi'o //
